title: Flash flooding kills 6 in West Virginia, rescue teams searching for missing people
summary: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains killed five people in northern West Virginia and rescue crews were searching for three other people.
story: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains killed six people, including a 3-year-old child, in northern West Virginia on Sunday, as rescue crews resumed their search Monday morning for three others who remain missing.

The Wheeling-Ohio County Emergency Management Agency confirmed the sixth death on Monday.  According to the National Weather Service, a flood watch remains in effect through the evening as heavy rainfall is expected to continue throughout the day.
Officials said 2.5 to 4 inches of rain fell in parts of Wheeling and Ohio County within about half an hour on Saturday night.

"We almost immediately started getting 911 calls for rescue of people being trapped," Lou Vargo, Ohio County's emergency management director, said at a news conference Sunday. "During this time, we had major infrastructure damage to roads, bridges, and highways where we couldn't respond to a lot of incidents. So we were delayed in getting there because there was just so much damage."
Vargo added: "It happened so quickly and so fast. … I've been doing this for 35 years. I've seen major floods here in the city and the county. I've never seen anything like this."
Authorities said vehicles were swept into swollen creeks, some people sought safety in trees, and a mobile home caught fire.

Gov. Patrick Morrisey declared a state of emergency in Marion County Sunday evening following swift flash flooding that caused extensive damage and resulted in at least 165 calls to the county's 911 line.

Emergency crews responded to the partial collapse of the Fairmont Village Apartment building Sunday evening, Morrisey confirmed in a Facebook post. No one was transported for injuries and multiple cars were totaled, according to NBC affiliate WBOY.
Although the official cause of the collapse has not been identified, WBOY reports that it is believed to have been caused by the flooding.

Jim Blazier, the fire chief in Wheeling in the state's northern panhandle, said crews performed rescue operations into Sunday's early morning hours. He said first responders regrouped Sunday morning and were focused on an area from the Ohio state line across the Ohio River to Wheeling Creek.

"We're searching the banks, we're searching submerged vehicles, any debris we find along the trail and so forth," Blazier said. "We're using drones, search dogs and swift water personnel, and we have teams organized that are searching sectors that we're trying to recover anybody that's missing."

Morrisey confirmed in a news release Sunday evening that about 2,500 power outages were reported in the county. He has declared a state of emergency in Ohio County and mobilized the National Guard to support emergency operations.

The Wheeling-Ohio County Emergency Management Agency said various supplies, such as water, non-perishable food, paper products, and clothes, will be available for those impacted by the flooding at two locations beginning at 10 a.m. Monday. Supplies can be retrieved at 25 Armory Drive in Wheeling and  G45 Caliber Drive in Triadelphia.

title: Justin Bieber Shares Lengthy Instagram Post About ‘Anger Issues’: ‘I Know I’m Broken’
summary: Justin Bieber shared a message to his followers saying he knows he's "broken" one day after Father's Day
story: Justin Bieber shared a message to his followers saying he knows he's "broken" one day after Father's Day.
The singer posted on Instagram June 16, writing that he knows he has anger issues and that he "tried to do the work" his entire life to be more like people who told him he needed to be "fixed."
"People keep telling me to heal," Bieber wrote. "Don't you think if I could have fixed myself I would have already?"

"I know I'm broken. I know I have anger issues," he continued. "I tried to do the work my whole life to be like the people who told me I needed to be fixed like them. And it just keeps making me more tired and angry."
Bieber, 31, added the harder he tries to grow, the more focused on himself he becomes.
"Jesus is the only person who keeps me wanting to make my life about others," he said. "Because honestly I'm exhausted with learning about myself lately aren't you?"
Bieber captioned the post with a middle finger emoji, which he also used to caption most of his 18 Instagram posts he published on Sunday, June 15.
Some of the Sunday posts included photos of his son, Jack, and wife, Hailey Bieber, with some showing the pair playing piano together, and another of Jack's hand with a bracelet on it.
Other posts included pictures of Bieber's feet as he laid on the floor, and close ups of his face, including his first Father's Day post, which he captioned: "I’m a dad that’s not to be f----- with."
Justin and Hailey Bieber announced the birth of their first child in August after sharing they were expecting in May 2024.
“WELCOME HOME,” Justin Bieber captioned an Instagram post on Aug. 23, before sharing the baby’s name. “JACK BLUES BIEBER.”
Since Jack's birth, Justin Bieber has shared snippets into his life as a dad, including a carousel of photos posted in January showing him and his wife enjoying time outside in the snow.
In one photo, he's seen carrying Jack in a baby harness on his chest, though only the back of the baby's head is visible.

title: Rebel Wilson Reveals Wife Ramona Has Cameo in Her New Film 'Bride Hard'
summary: Rebel Wilson didn't have to look far when they needed someone to fill a small role in her new comedy action film, "Bride Hard."
story: Rebel Wilson didn't have to look far when they needed someone to fill a small role in her new comedy action film, "Bride Hard."
Wilson's wife, fashion designer Ramona Agruma, makes her big-screen debut with a cameo in the upcoming movie, where Wilson plays a secret agent who is also the maid of honor at her friend's wedding.
Wilson wasn't the first one who wanted to get Agruma on screen, as the "Real Housewives" franchise made an entreaty to her before her small role in "Bride Hard," which hits theaters on June 20.
"She was actually offered, but she has no desire to be in the spotlight," Wilson told Savannah Guthrie on June 16 on TODAY.

"But weirdly she has a cameo in 'Bride Hard' because they needed somebody to speak Russian to play a Russian scientist," she continued. "And so Ramona’s like, ‘Yeah, all right.’ She just stepped in. She’s not an actress, but she just came in and crushed it. I was like, ‘Babe, you’re actually good.’"
Agruma was raised in Latvia and speaks multiple languages, including German and Russian.

In addition to her wife's cameo, Wilson survived a wild moment during the filming of an action scene in the movie. She said she had her "nose slashed open" on the last night of shooting and had to get plastic surgery.
"It was hardcore," she said.

The couple tied the knot in September 2024 at a ceremony in Sardinia, Italy.  Agruma, who’s the founder of the Los Angeles-based clothing brand Lemon Ve Limon, had been dating Wilson for two years. The two announced their engagement in February 2023.
They also are parents of Wilson's daughter, Royce Lillian Elizabeth Wilson, who was born via surrogate on Nov. 7, 2023.

title: 'Sister Wives': Meri Brown Debunks Rumors that She Introduced Kody to Robyn
summary: Meri Brown wants "Sister Wives" viewers to know one important thing about Kody and Robyn Brown's meet-cute
story: Meri Brown wants "Sister Wives" viewers to know one important thing about Kody and Robyn Brown's meet-cute.
In a the last "Sister Wives: One on One" special of Season 19, the reality star sets the record straight about how Kody and Robyn Brown really met.
The topic comes up when host Sukanya Krishnan asks if Meri Brown has "any regrets" about introducing the couple.
"I didn’t introduce Robyn to Kody," she replies.
"You didn’t?" Krishnan asks in shock.
"No. There’s this whole big thing out there on the Twittersphere right now that I introduced them. I did not introduce them," the reality star says.
Meri Brown was the first of Kody Brown's four wives. In recent years, Christine Brown Woolley and Janelle Brown have also left the father of 18, leaving him with one remaining wife, Robyn Brown.
While speaking with Krishnan, Meri Brown clarifies that she and her husband were indeed together when they met Robyn Brown for the first time.

"So we’re driving down the road, and our neighbors, our friends, they were all outside talking. So we stopped to say hi to our friends. He was talking to (Robyn's) cousin’s husband and she and I kind of started talking and we just kind of felt this connection," she explains.
In his own interview with Krishnan, Kody Brown adds to the story, saying, "Meri made a connection with Robyn, and Robyn and I were kind of avoiding contact with each other."
Kody Brown goes on to say he was "fishing" for information about Robyn Brown's relationship status when he first started talking to her.
"I mean, Meri's right there and besides, I was a little embarrassed cause I didn't let go (of eye contact) the first time (I'd seen Robyn before that)," he says.
This was actually the second time Kody Brown had laid eyes on his future wife, according to the episode. The first occurred at church.
"I see her sitting there and I figure, 'OK, she’s got to be about 28 or 30. And she's by herself. And I made eye contact with her and I couldn’t look away," he recalls later during the interview.
The couple didn't end up talking that first time around, but they shared a powerful gaze.
"Finally she looks away and I’m like, 'Oh.' I kind of woke up from a trance," Kody Brown says.
After Kody and Robyn Brown shared their first actual conversation, Meri Brown encouraged her husband to look into her, describing her as "cute."
From there, Meri, Christine and Kody Brown attended a dance together where Robyn Brown was in attendance.
"Christine had gone home early and it was nearly the last dance. And Meri’s like, 'You should go ask Robyn to dance,'" he recalls.
When he stepped on the dance floor with Robyn Brown, Kody Brown said it became a "serendipitously beautiful" experience.

"It’s like all of a sudden there’s nobody but us on the dance floor. And I’m talking to her like we’ve known each other our whole lives. (It was) the kind of safety combined with just the depth of connections. She was very vulnerable. And I was at the time. There was a depth of connection that I do not believe I have ever had," he says.
When asked if he had a similar moment with his other wives, Kody Brown says, "Not that I recall."
"It was more of like a pragmatic thought process," he says.

title: Kody Brown Shuts Down 'Sister Wives' Interview For 'Crossing the Line'
summary: Kody Brown was upset when a Sister Wives interview focused on his sexuality. Here's what he said and how he shut it down.
story: Kody Brown grows increasingly agitated during a conversation about his sexual relationship with one of his wives in the final “Sister Wives: One on One” special of Season 19.
The topic comes up when host Sukanya Krishnan plays a clip of the reality star talking about a “sexual experience” he had in college that went against his “religious values.”
Later on, she asks if Kody Brown had “any other sexual experiences” before he met Meri Brown, his first wife.
The father of 18 laughs as he says, “There were other options that got close.”
Kody Brown goes on to describe himself as “Mormon naughty” in high school.
“What does ‘Mormon naughty’ mean?” Krishnan then asks.
“It means I would kiss and hug, but no actual intercourse,” he explains.
Krishnan then uses sports terms to relate to the reality star, who played football in school. “So you never got the touchdown, but you got some picks,” she says.
Kody Brown laughs awkwardly in response and says, “You know, out of respect for my wife, I’m going to quit discussing this with you. You guys can act like it’s the world’s business all you want.”
“We’re just having some fun,” Krishnan notes.
“No, we just crossed a line, so it’s done,” he says, still smirking.

The scene then shifts to Christine Brown Woolley, one of Kody Brown’s three ex-wives, who suggests that Kody and Robyn Brown may have been sexually intimate before marriage despite their claims otherwise.
“We’ve all seen their engagement photos and I just automatically think, ‘Huh.’ I wonder how close they got before they were married,” she says.

Robyn Brown then addresses the situation in her own interview with Krishnan, saying, “He didn’t kiss me until he asked me to marry him. And it wasn’t a kiss. It was a stamp. You know, his face smashed mine. That was it. You know, it wasn’t anything super sexy.”
When Krishnan pushes the topic, bringing up Christine Brown Woolley’s speculations, Robyn Brown says she and Kody Brown only shared “little church kisses” before their wedding.
“Something you can do in front of your pastor or your bishop,” she says.
The scene returns to Kody Brown and Krishnan, who says she “loved our conversation about Mormon naughtiness.” Kody Brown then shuts down.
“No, we’re not talking about my sexuality. No, come on. That was, crossing the line.
“No, it was not about your sexuality. It’s about you and Robyn,” Krishnan clarifies.
“That was not a cool discussion,” he says as he shifts in his seat.
The reality star then explains why he’s so annoyed.
“I give a little bit here and it’s like, I give an inch. I’m generous. And it’s like, ‘Well, let’s dig into his life.’ I didn’t think that was cool,” he says.
While appearing on an episode of “The Sarah Fraser Show,” Krishnan recently addressed another moment during their interview that led Kody Brown to stare at her in silence.
“The stare down is pretty awesome. When it was happening, I was like, ‘Is he not talking?’ I was in my head. I was like, ‘Is he just not going to talk to me?’” she said.
Krishnan elaborated on the matter, saying, “It went on for about a minute 30. Think about staring at somebody for a minute 30 dead in their eyes.”

title: Are Shannon and Earl Together After ‘Bravo’s Love Hotel’? Why It’s ‘Hard’ for Her to Watch Now
summary: Shannon Storms Beador tells TODAY.com in an interview if she's together now romantically with Earl Thompson after connecting on "Bravo's Love Hotel."
story: From the beginning on “Bravo’s Love Hotel,” Shannon Storms Beador had her sights set on one man, but did their love story continue outside of the hotel?

The “Real Housewives of Orange County” star struck up a romance on the show in Los Cabos, Mexico, with Earl Thompson from Lawrenceville, Georgia. She even helped Earl get contact information for his estranged stepson, with assistance from her attorney back home.

Shannon, whose previous marriage to David Beador played out over the years on “RHOC,” says the No. 1 thing that attracted her to Earl was his “kind eyes” and the eye contact he maintained. “He was engaged in a conversation,” she tells TODAY.com. “I need to be a priority. I don’t feel like I’ve been a priority in any of the relationships that I’ve been in, and so, that’s my hope.”

Earl was previously married twice and lost one of his wives to leukemia, which is one of the first things he told Shannon when they met. While Shannon and Earl had many sweet moments together, they also had their share of disagreements.

Shannon initially got upset when Earl didn’t comfort her on a particularly emotional night for her: the one-year anniversary of her DUI arrest. A few episodes later, Earl was not happy with Shannon for choosing to go out with her “Love Hotel” castmates, Luann de Lesseps, Ashley Darby and Gizelle Bryant, instead of being there for him as he stressed over the path of a hurricane headed toward his Florida and Georgia homes.
“I did have a few hiccups with Earl,” Shannon says, “but there’s something about him that when we were together and things were good, it was really good.”
Despite her ups and downs with Earl in Mexico, she says she was “easily sucked back in” after filming for the show ended.
“After the show, we did — we talked every day,” she says. “I went and stayed with him in Georgia. He came out to Orange County, but in the end, it didn’t work out.”
“We have very different personalities, in the long run,” she explains. “And we were in a bubble there, but I wish it would’ve been different. But it is what it is.”
“It’s sad for me,” she says. “I’ll be honest with you, it’s hard to watch the show right now because I remember that I cared about him, and so it’s hard.”
Shannon says she has no interest in dating at this time because she does not want to get hurt again.
“I know that when I watch a show, and I’m invested in certain people, I want them to stay together,” she says. “So it was important for me to try my hardest to make it work.”

As for what she’s looking for in a partner, Shannon, who also describes herself as “a relationship girl,” says she, most importantly, wants someone with “a kind heart,” adding that looks are “not that important.”
“I want someone that’s intelligent and that has a sense of humor, because I like to learn from people,” she says.

“I didn’t think that I would be OK on my own, but now that I have been, I kind of like it,” Shannon, who says she does not use dating apps, explains. After her marriage ended, she began dating John Janssen in 2019, and the two very publicly broke up in 2022. Janssen has since moved on with “RHOC” alum Alexis Bellino.

“In my perfect world, I would meet someone who is confident, successful and thinks it’s really cute that I’m on this silly show and doesn’t want to be a part of it. Because that’s a really hard thing when you’ve been doing it for as long as we have, that, you know, does someone want to be famous or not?” Shannon says.
“That’s what happened in my last relationship,” she adds. “He wanted to be, and I didn’t think he did.”

title: George, Charlotte and Louis Wish Prince William Happy Father's Day With ‘Before and After’ Pics
summary: Princes George and Louis and Princess Charlotte took over their parents' Instagram page to share a special message for dad William, Prince of Wales.“Happy Father’s Day, Papa (before and after!) We love you!
story: Princes George and Louis and Princess Charlotte took over their parents' Instagram page to share a special message for dad William, Prince of Wales.
“Happy Father’s Day, Papa (before and after!) We love you! G, C & L,” the young royals said in an Instagram post June 15, signed with their initials.
The post features two new photos of Prince William with his children. In the “before” photo, the siblings smiled and stood beside their dad, with Charlotte hugging tight to younger brother Louis.

The “after” image was seemingly taken after their photoshoot and saw George, Charlotte and Louis piling on top of their dad in the grass. Charlotte looked directly at the camera in the black-and-white image, appearing to be mid-laugh.
The Father's Day post comes just one day after the family attended the annual Trooping the Colour ceremony, traditionally held to honor the king's birthday, on June 14.
Charlotte twinned in bright blue with mom Catherine, Princess of Wales, who made a joyful appearance at the event, her first time at the parade since announcing she's in remission from cancer.

Louis, who turned 7 in April, historically charms the world with his facial expressions and antics at the event. This year, Louis again seemed to delight onlookers, as well as King Charles III and Queen Camilla.

The royal family celebrated Mother’s Day in the United Kingdom on March 30. The former Kate Middleton personally marked the occasion with a dedication to Mother Nature, writing, “Over the past year, nature has been our sanctuary.”
Kate announced her cancer diagnosis in March 2024 and shared news of her remission in January 2025.

“This Mother’s Day, let us celebrate Mother Nature and recognise how our bond with the natural world can help not only nurture our inner selves, but remind us too of the role we play within the rich tapestry of life,” she said on Instagram before signing off, C.

title: Jamie Lee Curtis Reveals the Hilarious Catchphrase She Shares with Mariska Hargitay
summary: Jamie Lee Curtis tells TODAY.com in an interview at the "My Mom Jayne" premiere about her friendship with Mariska Hargitay and the one phrase they both love.
story: Some of the best friendships come along later in life — just ask Jamie Lee Curtis, who over the past few years, discovered her “secret sister,” Mariska Hargitay.
The Oscar winner supported her friend June 13 at Hargitay’s Tribeca Festival premiere for “My Mom Jayne,” a documentary about the “Law & Order: SVU” star’s mother, Jayne Mansfield.
Curtis couldn’t be prouder of Hargitay for not only sharing Mansfield’s story, but also making her film directorial debut with the HBO Original project.

“She’s been carrying her family story for a long time, and it’s time for her to shed it in this gorgeous documentary and now step free as an artist,” Curtis said in an interview with TODAY.com at the event. “Now we have a filmmaker.”

Curtis often elevates women in the entertainment industry on her social media accounts, from hyping up her “The Last Showgirl” co-star Pamela Anderson to showing support for her longtime pal Jodie Foster.
“I think any time we can see women step up and out and into the light of their truth, and do it with grace and humor and love and beauty, that’s a message that I think does translate,” Curtis said.
Curtis and Hargitay began hanging out in recent years and documented their blossoming friendship on social media.
“Fierce female friendship alert. Love this lady. #WhereYouBeenAllMyLife#SisterFromAnotherMister🤝,” Hargitay captioned a photo of herself with Curtis on Instagram in August 2023.
At the premiere, Curtis shared more insight into what her hangs with Hargitay look like.
“We laugh a lot,” she told TODAY.com. “The f-word is dropped — a lot, and we both say, ‘Hold, please,’ a lot, like, a lot.”
“I’ve never met somebody else who says, ‘Hold, please,’ as much as I do,” she continued, even acting out an example by mimicking scrolling through a phone and saying, “Hold, please. Hold, please.”
“The two of us are like little parrots,” she added.
In December 2024, both women shared black-and-white pics of themselves posing together in matching black outfits, with Curtis sharing a message of support for Hargitay’s “secret project.”
In April, Curtis reflected on their friendship in another Instagram post, which featured a series of photos of the duo posing and laughing.

“The universe is funny. It kept my secret, matching glasses, soul sister, from me for a LONG TIME and then the connect the dots of family, home, marriage, children and careers which has taken us from strangers to comrades to sobbing babies to the hyenas we became within seconds of seeing each other,” she wrote, concluding the caption by expressing her excitement for “My Mom Jayne” and Hargitay’s “continued brilliance” as Olivia Benson on “SVU.”

title: Mark Hamill Addresses Speculation That He 'Quit' the 'Star Wars' Franchise
summary: Mark Hamill believes his time in the "Star Wars" universe has come to an end, but he does want to make one thing clear about his reported departure from the legendary franchise: he did not quit."Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me," he clarified in a preview clip from his upcoming Sunday Sitdown interview with Willie Geist.
story: Mark Hamill believes his time in the "Star Wars" universe has come to an end, but he does want to make one thing clear about his reported departure from the legendary franchise: he did not quit.
"Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me," he clarified in a preview clip from his upcoming Sunday Sitdown interview with Willie Geist. "It’s not like they said, ‘Please come back.’”
The 73-year-old actor, who portrayed the iconic Luke Skywalker in six "Star Wars" films, expanded upon recent comments that his time with the legendary sci-fi franchise is done.

"I don't want to make a big PR pronouncement like 'This is my decision,'" Hamill said. "I’m just saying that it really felt like a conclusion. My character was given complete closure. I died, ironically by overdosing on the Force, I might point out."

In the 2017 film "The Last Jedi," Skywalker dies at the end, melding with The Force. Hamill then makes another appearance as Skywalker's Force spirit in the 2019 sequel "The Rise of Skywalker." That film marked the seeming end of a character arc that began with a young Skywalker in the original "Star Wars" in 1977.

"Once the Skywalker trilogy was over, it was a whole new era for them," Hamill said. "(Creator) George (Lucas) gave them this amazing canvas, the entire galaxy. They can do Westerns, mysteries, comedies, whodunits, anything within that realm of 'Star Wars.' And they’re doing so well. I love 'Rogue One,' 'Mandalorian, 'Book of Boba Fett.'"
Hamill generated headlines and fan buzz about him officially being done with "Star Wars" when he told ComicBook.com on May 31 that he felt the story should move on without him.

"I am so grateful to George (Lucas) for letting me be a part of that back in the day, the humble days when George called 'Star Wars' '‘the most expensive low-budget movie ever made,’” Hamill told the site. "We never expected it to become a permanent franchise and a part of pop culture like that. But my deal is, I had my time. I’m appreciative of that, but I really think they should focus on the future and all the new characters.”
While Hamill is ready to close the book on his "Star Wars" chapter, he added that he has not turned down any subsequent appearances as Skywalker.
"I just think it’s time. I had my time," he told Willie. "I’m really appreciative, but I’m really looking to the future for all these new projects.

But I do know, when I mentioned anything about the space movies, it gets extra scrutiny, as opposed to me talking about anything else. I said that, and then I saw headlines, you know 'Mark Hamill Quit Star Wars.' Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me. It’s not like they said, 'Please come back.'"
There's also the fact that Skywalker died in "The Last Jedi."

"Yeah, exactly. I mean, come on. How much can you do when the Force goes?" Hamill said. "I’d like to see a movie set all in the Force ghost realm. You know, I could have conversations with (late Obi-Wan Kenobi actor) Alec Guinness and all."
"Oh, now you're giving them ideas," Willie joked.
The full Sunday Sitdown interview with Hamill will air on Sunday TODAY on June 15.

Meanwhile, Hamill's latest project, "The Life of Chuck," based on Stephen King’s 2020 novella of the same name, hit theaters on June 13. In the film, Hamill plays the grandfather of the title character, whose life is portrayed over the years by four different actors.
“It’s so positive. It’s so optimistic about life,” Hamill told TODAY.com. “It also teaches you there are moments that, in life, you think are trivial that collectively become very important.”

title: Morgan Wallen Fans Rejoice After Seeing His 'I'm The Problem' Tour Setlist: 'Let's Go!'
summary: Morgan Wallen unveiled the setlist of his upcoming "I’m the Problem" tour. Which songs will he sing this summer?
story: Morgan Wallen just gave his fans some exciting news.
On June 13, the country singer, 32, revealed the setlist for his upcoming tour, “I’m the Problem,” and it features hits like, “Whiskey Glasses,” “Cowgirls” and “Ain’t That Some.”
The setlist shows that Wallen will be performing over 25 songs on his tour, which is expected to kickoff in Houston, Texas, on June 20.
“Solid playlist,” one fan commented on X.
Another wrote, “LETS GOOO! 1 WEEK FROM TODAY!”
A third added, “On repeat.”
The lineup did not include, however, one of the singer’s biggest hits from 2021: “7 Summers.”
Alongside crying and heartbreak emoji, one X user wrote, “7 Summers isn’t going to be performed this time around? It’s one of my favorite songs of all time.”
Another wrote, “7 Summers must be on this as well,” with a purple heart emoji.

In an interview with Apple Music Country, Wallen talked about his setlist and said he’s looking forward to playing “I’m a Little Crazy” and “I’m The Problem” from his titular studio album released this year.
“I love singing that song,” he said, referring to “I’m a Little Crazy.”

His track, “I’m The Problem,” has reached No. 2 on Billboard's Hot 100 and continues sit among the top songs nationwide. When it comes to his fans streaming the hit, Wallen told Apple Music that he already sees “how well” the bop is doing months after its release.
But when it comes to truly experiencing music, Wallen said it’s always best to listen live because “the energy” can’t be beat.

“I spend months at this point getting ready to get on tour, just getting in shape. I don’t have to be in any kind of crazy shape to record in the studio,” he said. “With how big my stage is, how much I run around, and how much effort that me and the guys put into it, I don’t think you would know that by just listening to the record.”

At the 2025 Grammys, Wallen was nominated for best country song and best country duo/group performance for his 2024 hit “I Had Some Help.” He ended up losing, however, to Kacey Musgraves in the former category and to Beyoncé and Miley Cyrus in the latter.
The same day Wallen revealed his set list, the singer took to Instagram to share what else he’s been up to lately.
Alongside a self-deprecating caption, Wallen posted a carousel of photos, including shots of himself golfing, performing on stage and enjoying a Doritos concoction, among other moments.
He captioned the post, “Mostly just been working on my farmers tan.”

title: Christina Hendricks Gets ‘Teary-Eyed,’ Mamie Gummer Talks ‘We Were Liars’ and More Behind the Scenes at TODAY
summary: From Mamie Gummer to Gerard Butler, TODAY.com unpacks highlights from interviewing celebrities behind the scenes at Studio 1A.
story: In Greenroom Confidential, reporters and editors at TODAY.com share a look at what actors, authors, performers and more guests shared behind the scenes at TODAY.

Even though summer doesn't officially begin for another week, things  were definitely heating up in Studio 1A. From Bryan Cranston and Orlando Bloom to Leighton Meester and  Christina Hendricks, the summer season kicked off with a variety of guests. TODAY.com got plenty of updates on some of their latest and most memorable projects. Read all about it right here.
Greg Kinnear Imagines an Alternate 'Sabrina' Ending

Veteran actor Greg Kinnear stopped by Studio 1A to talk about his latest role as a fire chief in the crime thriller "Smoke," a new series dropping on Apple TV+ on June 27. Also starring Taron Egerton, Jurnee Smollett and John Leguizamo, the show tracks a pair of arsonists wreaking havoc in a small, Pacific Northwest town.

Based on a true story, Kinnear told TODAY.com that like a fire, the series starts small and gets bigger. "It's a hell of a story and it's a hell of a great cast of actors and everybody has a lot going on in terms of their journey," he said.
Of course, TODAY.com couldn't resist asking about "Sabrina," the romantic comedy he starred in back in 1995. "That was my first film," recalled Kinnear.
"Sydney Pollack put me in it to play Harrison Ford's younger brother ... no pressure," he laughed.
Ford naturally ends up with the girl, but according to Kinnear, his character, playboy David Larrabee, should've gotten her instead.

"I definitely think they should have ended up together," he said, jokingly. "I think it would've ended in a quick annulment, but it would've been a wonderful four days before she realized, 'What the hell have I done?' So, good for her."
Mamie Gummer on the 'Trauma' of Inherited Wealth in 'We Were Liars'

Mamie Gummer joined the TODAY co-hosts on Tuesday and chatted about working with her mother, Meryl Streep, in the 2015 movie "Ricki and the Flash," as well as her on-screen debut as a toddler in the 1986 movie "Heartburn," which also stars Streep.

While she didn't rule out joining the Oscar winner once again in some kind of "family affair" project down the road, Gummer had plenty to say about her current role as Carrie Sinclair in "We Were Liars."

The new Prime Video series is a thriller, revolving around a wealthy family with plenty of hidden secrets. Based on the bestselling novel by E. Lockhart, Gummer sat down with TODAY.com to talk about why shows that reveal the dark underbelly of extreme wealth (think "Succession") are currently having a moment.
"It's sort of a dismantling of that kind of aspirational wealth and about the inherited trauma that comes with inherited wealth, specifically," she said.
"It's a little like, 'Be careful what you wish for, because you just might get it,'" she continued.

Gummer also said that family drama is something just about everyone can relate to. "When I go home, my family gets together, (and) you kind of tend to regress into an adolescent state or you're more petulant, not your best selves," she said with a laugh.
Gerard Butler on Reprising a Familiar Role in a 'Whole New World'

Fifteen years after lending his voice to “How to Train Your Dragon,” Gerard Butler is reprising his role in the story for the 2025 live action adaptation, which hit theaters June 13. In both films, Butler plays Stoick the Vast, chieftain of a Viking village and father to teenage Hiccup struggling to find his place.

When it comes to reaching fans of the original film and kids encountering this story for the first time, Butler told TODAY.com with the live action format, “we had a chance to make things richer, more nuanced, to maybe push the drama a little more.”
He credited the film’s effects with creating “a whole new world everybody had to be entranced by.”

“It felt like people who knew the animated, who love the animated, I think we were all richly confident that they would go inside, and within five minutes, they’re not thinking about the animated movie,” he added. “This just sucks you in, and it becomes its own story in its own world.”
Christina Hendricks Appears on TODAY in a Dress She Designed
Just a few days before “The Buccaneers” returns for Season 2, Christina Hendricks stopped by Studio 1A to preview what’s ahead for the romantic, historical romp.

While appearing on TODAY, Hendricks wore a patterned V-neck dress, with slightly puffed sleeves and floral decorations. After her interview, Hendricks revealed to TODAY.com the dress is part of her upcoming collaboration with Joanie Clothing.
“I did a capsule line of 12 dresses that I designed, and to wear it on (TODAY) is — I'm going to get teary-eyed — it's like a dream come true,” she said. “It’ll be out in the fall.”

Set in the 1870s, “The Buccaneers,” based on the unfinished novel by Edith Wharton, follows a group of American girls who travel to London for marriage prospects. Hendricks plays Patti St. George, mother to Jinny (Imogen Waterhouse) and Nan (Kristine Froseth).
Season 2 will pick up at the same moment where Season 1, which premiered in 2023, left off: at Nan's wedding to Theo, the Duke of Tintagel.
“Patti’s still at the wedding because we pick up in the exact same moment,” Hendricks said, adding that her character’s time back in New York, without her two daughters, is set to be rocky.

“New York isn’t a welcoming place for Patti right now because she makes this big announcement at the end of Season 1 that she’s going to proceed with a divorce,” she said. “We really dive into the divorce trial this year.”

title: Prince Louis Makes the Royals Break Character as He Waves From Buckingham Palace's Balcony
summary: Prince William and Kate Middleton's kids, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis, attended the Trooping the Colour event in London on June 14.
story: It was a royal family affair at the 2025 Trooping the Colour celebration in London on Saturday, June 14.

In honor of the official birthday of the British monarch, King Charles III, the royal family gathered on the balcony of Buckingham Palace as they watched the celebratory fly-past of military aircraft and helicopters above.

Similar to past years, Prince Louis stole the show and seemed to charm his grandparents, King Charles and Queen Camilla, along with his parents, Prince William, Princess Catherine, and siblings, Prince George and Princess Charlotte, as he waved to the crowd of onlookers below.

The seven-year-old has become a staple at the annual event which   features over 1,400 soldiers and officers, accompanied by 200 horses. Queen Camilla seemed the most entertained by Louis, who was lovingly restrained by bis big brother George at one point during the ceremony.
William and Catherine, Prince and Princess of Wales, also appeared to be in great spirits during the balcony ceremony. The couple, along with their children were all fashionably dressed.
The former Kate Middleton, 43, wore a fitted aqua colored jacket with matching hat, while William, 42, was dressed in regal attire just like his dad King Charles.

Prince George, 11, matched with his little brother Prince Louis, who wore a navy blue suit with a red tie. Meanwhile their sister, Princess Charlotte, twinned with their mom in a light aqua colored dress with a white neckline and midsection.

Prince Louis appeared to be having such a good time at the event that he didn't want leave. As the royals made their exit from the Buckingham Palace balcony, Louis turned around to give one more goodbye wave. His sister Charlotte also took one last look before she was ushered away by her mom.

While the annual event is to celebrate King Charles' birthday, the monarch requested changes to this year's Trooping the Colour to honor those who died in the devastating Air India plane crash on June 12 that killed over 200 people.
King Charles wanted the parade to serve “as a mark of respect for the lives lost, the families in mourning and all the communities affected by this awful tragedy,” according to a palace spokesperson.
The royal family's appearance at this year's event marked the first time Kate has attended the annual festivities since she announced in January that she's officially in remission from cancer.
The mom of three announced in a March 2024 video statement that she'd been diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer after undergoing major abdominal surgery the previous January.

title: Prince George and Prince Louis Make Adorable Faces During Trooping the Colour
summary: Prince Louis had all eyes on him — again — at the 2025 Trooping the Colour birthday celebration for his granddad, King Charles III
story: Prince Louis had all eyes on him — again — at the 2025 Trooping the Colour birthday celebration for his granddad, King Charles III.

The puckish 7-year-old royal, who's become known for his antics at royal appearances, appeared alongside his siblings, Prince George, 11, and Princess Charlotte, 10, and their parents, William, Prince of Wales, and Catherine, Princess of Wales outside Buckingham Palace during the annual festivities.

Similar to previous years, Prince Louis shared some candid reactions as he made his way to Buckingham Palace with his family. But this time around, his big brother, Prince George, joined in on his revelry as they both appeared to be having a bit of fun as they sat alongside their mom, Catherine, Princess of Wales, and their sister Princess Charlotte.

Prince George appeared to be enjoying the carriage ride with his family during the Trooping the Colour ceremony at the Horse Guards Parade. He was captured joining in on his brother's silly antics by saying what appeared to be a silent prayer. From the side profile, their mom, Princess Catherine, appeared to smiling and perhaps laughing at their fun brotherly moment.

This isn't the first time Prince Louis has charmed onlookers at Trooping the Colour. In 2023, Louis hammed it up as he made a series of adorable faces and held up his fists to imitate a pilot during the celebratory fly-past of about 70 military aircraft and helicopters.
Just last month, the impish prince stole the show again at a May 5 military parade honoring the 80th anniversary of V-E Day in Britain, which marked the end of World War II in Europe.
Louis took time out from the parade to brush off the shoulder of the military uniform worn by his dad, who was sitting alongside him.
He also stuck out his tongue and pouted at other points during the celebration and was even caught rolling his eyes.
The icing on the cake was when Louis mimicked his big brother, George. After George absent-mindedly flipped his hair back, Louis followed by performing a cheeky impression of him.

title: Kate Middleton Twins and Laughs With Princess Charlotte at 1st Trooping The Colour Since Cancer Remission
summary: Kate Middleton, the Princess and Prince of Wales, arrived with her three children by her side at the Trooping Of The Colour.
story: Catherine, Princess of Wales, has made a jubilant return to the 2025 Trooping the Colour event, marking her first time at the annual festivities since announcing she's in remission from cancer.

The former Kate Middleton, 43, smiled at onlookers at the June 14 celebration, which honors the birthday of her father-in-law, King Charles III. In a carriage, Kate sat alongside her and Prince William's three kids: Prince George, 11; Princess Charlotte, 10; and Prince Louis, 7.

Kate also appeared to coordinate with her daughter, Princess Charlotte, as they both wore a light blue to the big event. Kate donned a dress coat with an embroidered hat while Charlotte wore an aqua colored dress with her hair pulled back in braids.
The two were also seen sharing a laugh during a sweet mommy-daughter moment that was captured.
Kate announced in a rare March 2024 video statement that she had been diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer after  undergoing major abdominal surgery in January 2024.
She added that she was in the “early stages” of preventative chemotherapy treatment.
Kate's diagnosis came a little more than month after Buckingham Palace announced King Charles III had been diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer.
Kate attended last year's Trooping the Colour event, which marked her first public event since her cancer diagnosis.
Kate confirmed she would attend the celebration in a statement June 14, 2024, which was her first update on her health since announcing her diagnosis.

“I am making good progress, but as anyone going through chemotherapy will know, there are good days and bad days. On those bad days you feel weak, tired and you have to give in to your body resting. But on the good days, when you feel stronger, you want to make the most of feeling well,” she said.
In September 2024, the mom of three announced she’d finished chemotherapy and called herself “cancer-free.”
She followed up in January 2025, by announcing she was officially in remission.
“It is a relief to now be in remission and I remain focussed on recovery. As anyone who has experienced a cancer diagnosis will know, it takes time to adjust to a new normal.
"I am however looking forward to a fulfilling year ahead. There is much to look forward to. Thank you to everyone for your continued support. C,” she wrote on Instagram at the time.

title: Taylor Swift Has Sweet Moment With Patients at the Children's Hospital in Florida
summary: The patients at the Joe DiMaggio Children's Hospital were pleasantly surprised when Taylor Swift stopped by to say hi.
story: The patients at the Joe DiMaggio Children's Hospital were pleasantly surprised when Taylor Swift stopped by to say hi.
The 35-year-old pop star visited the Hollywood, Florida, hospital on June 13, to spend time with patients and staff, taking pictures with them and giving them signed copies of a book.

“You made this a day we’ll never shake off. Thank you, @taylorswift13 for bringing your support and kindness to Joe DiMaggio Children’s Hospital,” the hospital’s official X account tweeted. “You turned hospital hallways into a place of joy, comfort, and connection.”
One video shared on the social media platform shows the superstar entering one young patient’s room, who looks visibly shocked as she says, “I’m Taylor, nice to meet you.”
“What the?!” the patient named Zoe says, as Swift admires her nails.
“Are you kidding me? That is beautiful. Is this like a cat eye?” she asks, with Zoe replying, “Yeah.”
Swift then asks the young girl for a hug and says she hopes she feels better soon. The video ends with Zoe saying, “Holy cow, I just hugged Taylor Swift.”
In another video, the patient is just as stunned to see the “Lover” singer entering their room.
“Hello,” Swift says, as the patient says, “Oh my god,” and covers their mouth.
Complimenting the decorations in the room, she then introduces herself to someone off camera
“Hey, how are you? I’m Taylor,” she says, with the patient quipping, “Yeah!”
Excited, the two share an embrace before she asks the patient about their twin sister, who happens to be on FaceTime.
The hospital also shared a number of photos from Swift's visit, which show her with more patients and staff.

The multi-Grammy-winning artist's visit comes a day after she and boyfriend, Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce attended Game 4 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Edmonton Oilers and Florida Panthers.
The two were photographed inside the Amerant Bank Arena in Sunrise, Florida, cheering on the Panthers.

Meanwhile, the last time Swift shocked patients at a children's hospital was in 2024. One day before her 35th birthday, she visited the Children’s Mercy Hospital in Kansas City, the Associated Press reported.

title: Dark and 'Honest' Twist in 'Materialists' Explained by Director Celine Song
summary: "Materialists," starring Dakota Johnson, pulls back the curtain on the realities of dating in 2025, which at times can be traumatic.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for the film “Materialists.” Also, this story mentions sexual violence. If you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted, call the National Sexual Assault Telephone Hotline at 1-800-656-4673.
At first glance, “Materialists” is a classic romantic comedy, centering on a love triangle between Dakota Johnson, Pedro Pascal and Chris Evans’ characters.
The trailer, teasing the film directed by Celine Song, even includes Madonna’s hit pop song “Material Girl,” adding to the fun and playful rom-com element.
However, in “Materialists,” Song pulls back the curtain on the realities of dating in 2025, which at times can be traumatic.

Lucy (Johnson) is a successful matchmaker with nine engagements under her belt. When she meets with her clients, they give her height, weight, age and even salary requirements they want in a partner. It's all facts and math.
For quite some time, Lucy has been unsuccessfully working with one longtime, middle-aged client name Sophie (Zoë Winters). That is until Lucy sets her up with Mark (not seen in the film).
On paper, Mark checks all of Sophie's boxes. But on their date, he assaults Sophie.

Lucy's boss, Violet, informs her of the incident and tells her that Sophie isn't pressing charges against her, only the company. Yet Lucy feels guilty for setting her client up with someone who turned violent and starts to question her career.

When she tries to get in contact with Sophie, she avoids her. When they do see each other, Sophie yells at Lucy for not fulling vetting the match and reminds her that she's a human being, not a business transaction.
When Sophie asks Lucy why she set her up with Mark, Lucy replies that he checked off all their boxes.
It's a somber turn in the film, putting the spotlight on the consequences of reducing people to facts. Song tells TODAY.com that she felt it was important to include this in the film.

“Like Lucy’s boss says, ‘This is dating, right?’ It’s kind of a natural part of dating, especially representing straight dating,” Song says, quoting the World Health Organization’s (WHO) statistics about violence against women.

“One in three women experience sexual assault in their life. So the idea that you have a story that is intended to really talk about love and dating, the way it feels in 2025, and to not include a story where there can be a violation trust, violation of everything, a crime ... It wouldn’t have felt honest to me.”
Later in the film, Sophie calls Lucy when Mark is outside her apartment and the police won't do anything. Lucy stays with her until she feels safe and helps her file a restraining order.

“I felt like if I was one being so real about so many different things, the truth is that the commodification and the objectification of each other relates to dehumanization,” Song explains. “And Sophie says, ‘Well, I’m not merchandise. I’m a person.’”
Song believed that for her to explain that idea in her film, she had to show “there are consequences to reducing people into numbers, because then you’re going to overlook who they are as peole.”
Adding, “I feel like it means that we’re not actually acknowledging the way that people are people.”

title: Hailee Steinfeld Calls This 1 Rule for Her Wedding to Josh Allen ‘One of the Best Decisions We Made’
summary: Hailee Steinfeld opened up about her wedding to Josh Allen for the first time and said they had a "no-phone wedding," which she fully recommends.
story: Hailee Steinfeld opened up about her wedding to Josh Allen for the first time and shared the request they had for guests that she calls one of the “best decisions” they made.
The "Sinners" star, 28, tied the knot with the Buffalo Bills quarterback, 29, in an outdoor wedding in Santa Barbara, California, on May 31 after two years of dating.
Steinfeld shared behind-the-scenes details about the couple's nuptials, which were helmed by wedding planner Mindy Weiss, in the latest edition of her Beau Society newsletter.

"We had a no-phone wedding — we wanted everyone to come and be present. Looking back, it was one of the best decisions we made. But that meant (photographer) Jose (Villa) had his work cut out for him, capturing all the magic for us," wrote Steinfeld, who included nearly two dozen images from the couple’s big day in her message to newsletter subscribers.
Later, in the "to try" section of her newsletter, she again recommended a phone-free experience for a wedding weekend.
"I metaphorically threw my phone in the ocean before our wedding weekend, and it was the best thing ever," she said. "11/10 recommend being unplugged and present."

On the night before they said “I do,” Steinfeld and Allen dined together with their families. When loved ones arrived the following day to the welcome party, the dress code was “vibrant elegance,” she wrote.
“It felt like a garden party, so fun and an entirely different vibe than our wedding day, which was ‘all-black black tie’ and felt very classic and bold,” she wrote.
The couple also broke from the tradition of a bride and groom not seeing each another before walking down the aisle.
“On the morning of our wedding, Josh and I met for breakfast just before 7. I’m so glad we did that. I don’t think I could’ve gone the whole day without seeing him!" wrote Steinfeld.

The "Pitch Perfect" star then shared details about her wedding dress, a custom Tamara Ralph design with “exquisite” tailoring. When her groom-to-be saw her in the dress, he later told her he was “stunned,” Steinfeld shared.
“On our wedding day, when I put on this dress, I actually lost my breath. I’ve never felt more like myself and more beautiful,” she shared.

“I added these long, sheer gloves that I’m obsessed with. They’re so delicate you can actually see my nail shape through the fabric (shout out Tom Bachik)! My veil was French Chantilly lace, and my incredible earrings were Mikimoto,” she added.
As for Allen, he “looked like the man of every dream I’ve ever had” in a custom Tom Ford tuxedo, Steinfeld wrote, jokingly adding, “RIP me.”
Steinfeld’s father walked her down the aisle, and instead of carrying a bouquet of flowers, she said she opted to hold “one single crystal rose.”

The newly minted husband and wife’s rollicking afterparty “included a DJ, cigar bar, lots of Angel Margarita, grilled cheese sandwiches, and chocolate chip cookies served with shot glasses of milk," Steinfeld said.

“The night ended at 3am with all our friends jumping in the pool in their dresses and tuxes,” she wrote, adding, “I didn’t jump in (I was wearing feathers), but I took photos, which I’ll share once I get our disposables back.”

title: 'The Bachelor' Star Grant Ellis Announces He and Juliana Pasquarosa Have Ended Their Engagement
summary: "The Bachelor" star Grant Ellis announced that he and Juliana Pasquarosa, his pick from Season 29, have called it quits and ended their engagement.
story: Another “Bachelor” couple has called it quits.
Season 29 lead Grant Ellis announced that he and Juliana Pasquarosa have split and ended their engagement, about three months after Bachelor Nation saw him propose during the March finale.
The 31-year-old former basketball player shared the news on his Instagram story June 13, alongside a photo of him and his former fiancée.

“This is one of the harder things I’ve had to write, but I want to share it honestly. Juliana and I have decided to end our relationship. We both gave this our best and poured a lot of love into each other, but after a lot of deep conversations, we’ve come to the understanding that we’re simply not the right fit long term,” Ellis began, adding that what they had “was meaningful.”
Ellis added that the connection they built during their time together on the show was real, “and so was the effort we made to continue once the cameras stopped rolling.”

“There’s no negativity here. No resentment. Just two people who care about each other and want the best for one another moving forward,” he continued. “I’ll always be grateful for what we shared and for the growth that came with it. Thank you to everyone who supported us and believed in our journey. This chapter is closing, but we’re both walking away with love and respect in our hearts.”
Pasquarosa also shared a photo of the two to her Instagram story, writing a lengthy statement about how grateful she was to share this experience with Ellis.

“It’s a gift to find someone who sees the world in a way that resonates with you, while also encouraging you to grow,” she said, adding that marriage is a commitment and one they both still believe in.

"We shared something meaningful, navigating a unique journey side by side, learning, growing and showing up for each other the best we knew how,” she continued, noting that this isn’t the ending they imagined but it’s one “filled with mutual respect, care, and hope for what’s ahead.”
During the March 25 finale, Ellis was torn between Pasquarosa and runner-up Litia Garr.
Heading into the final episode, Ellis said this was the “biggest decision” of his life “thus far.”
“They’re both amazing women,” Ellis told his dad. “What if it doesn’t work out?”
Ellis ultimately chose Pasquarosa, leaving Garr heartbroken after he had told her she was his “No. 1 emotional connection.”
During the live “After the Final Rose” special, the couple were still together. At the time, Pasquarosa described their journey to host Jesse Palmer as “a fever dream.”

title: Ariana Madix Shocks Fans With Brown Hair: ’A New Bombshell Has Entered The Villa’
summary: Ariana Madix has made a dramatic change to her hair
story: Ariana Madix has made a dramatic change to her hair.

The "Love Island USA" host looked like a completely different person when she debuted a new dark brown hair color on the Peacock reality dating show's June 12 episode. (Peacock and TODAY.com are owned by the same parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Madix vamped it up by wearing a torso-baring red pleather minidress and sky-high heels.
But is Madix's new hair color a wig? Celebrity stylist Carl Bembridge shared a behind-the-scenes video of Madix on Instagram that tagged the team of stylists who created her alluring look.
Bembridge himself was credited for styling Madix's "Italiya Wig."
He captioned the clip, “Moment On The Dark Side."
Fans responded to his video by praising the "Vanderpump Rules" star's dark hair in the comments.
"Oh hello !!!!!! Love the blonde but this is FUUUUUUNNNN !!!!!" wrote one, adding a fiery heart emoji.
"Ummmm this is a whole new person. Mama please stay on the dark side forever," joked another.
Added a third, "A new bombshell has entered the villa."
Madix told TODAY.com last month that as far as reality television goes, hosting “Love Island USA” has been a “much more positive experience” than being on “Vanderpump Rules.”

“It’s me and a whole team of people getting ready for all those moments and getting excited and being hyped up. Whereas, with ‘Vanderpump,’ it’s much different. It’s your real life. Sometimes moments are really fun and great, and sometimes they’re not,” she explained.

The show's production team also takes into consideration that she arrives to the show's set in Fiji after a 10-hour flight from Los Angeles. Member of the team, she said, go out of their way to make sure she looks and feels her best.

“(If I say) ‘Oh, I’m not feeling the way my butt looks in this,’ for example, (then it’s) OK, we won’t shoot from that angle.’ That would never happen on a show where people are just there to document the moments that you’re living.
"In fact, if you point it out, they might do that on purpose,” she added with a laugh.
Madix also liked that hosting the show has allowed her to create a new on-air persona.

“For me, it is a little bit of playing a character, like a version of yourself that’s not necessarily what you are just walking around in real life. My ‘Love Island’ hosting persona is not me,” she said. “It is, but it’s not.”

title: Whoopi Goldberg Says Kids Shouldn’t Be Coddled: 'Sometimes You Get Beat Up'
summary: Whoopi Goldberg said kids shouldn’t be coddled, and that 'sometimes you get beat up' in a discussion on The View.
story: Whoopi Goldberg said kids don’t need “coddling” — even in cases where they get “beat up.”
“I know, it’s terrible,” Goldberg, co-host of “The View,” said during a June 11 episode.

The discussion topic was a recent Wall Street Journal article about the rise of “No Contact” orders on college campuses. The Title IX notices limit contact between parties when, for example, one person reports domestic violence or sexual harassment. According to the WSJ, some college students are initiating the orders when dealing with lesser disputes in friendship or romantic relationships.

“Critics are saying these students are using these to avoid face-to-face conflict,” Goldberg said on-air. “We know lots of people try to avoid conflict, but should there be a different way to try to do this?”
Goldberg elaborated.
“When you had an issue ... your mother said, ‘Listen: Go down there and tell them you are not doing that,’” said Goldberg. “Coddling children — it’s not a good thing.”

Goldberg acknowledged that many kids haven't had the life experiences they need due to COVID interrupting their schooling and childhoods. She said parents might need to help kids learn those life lessons, but, "it doesn't mean you do it for them."

She pointed out, “Sometimes — and I know it’s terrible — sometimes you get beat up. Sometimes you have to make a decision. You have to say, ‘Listen, I didn’t like that. I didn’t like that.’ And then you have got to grow, you know?”
The “View” panel discussed the topic in more depth.
Co-host Sara Haines referenced a portion of the WSJ article about a college student allegedly requesting a no-contact order over “disagreements.”

“This is called being a grown adult ... this is what life looks like,”  said Haines. “College is the step between childhood and ‘On your own, kiddo’ — it doesn’t mean you’re not a phone call away to advise them — but you are teaching your kids and empowering them to navigate the world when you can’t be there.”

Haines added, “This is where you problem solve ... you have really hard conversations ... If I had called my mom and said, ‘Someone is being mean,’ she would be like, ‘OK, are you OK? Do you have food? Good. Bye.’”

“View” co-host Alyssa Farah Griffin said, “Totally agree,” adding,  “Learning conflict resolution is a key part of life. You’re going to need it in any job, any community you live in, any friendships that you’re in ... you have to just learn how to coexist with someone. It’s kind of a critical life skill.”

Co-host Sunny Hostin said, “I don’t know that these no-contact orders are the answer, but I will say ... even though an 18 year old is considered an adult ... they’re still trying to manage and since I’m parenting a 19 year old and a 22 year old, there are instances where they’re bullied. There are instances where it’s difficult for them to resolve that kind of conflict.”
Hostin added, “People are really cruel in this world.”

title: HGTV Host and Exec Loren Ruch Dies at 55 From Leukemia
summary: Loren Ruch, who co-hosted the 2021 HGTV series “HGTV House Party" and was head of content at the network, has died from leukemia, Warner Bros. said in a memo to employees.
story: Loren Ruch, who co-hosted the 2021 HGTV series “HGTV House Party" and was head of content for the network, has died at 55.
Warner Bros. Television Group chairman Channing Dungey shared the news in a memo to employees, obtained by TODAY.com on June 13.

“It is with incredible sadness that I write to tell you about the loss of one of our beloved colleagues,” she began. “Loren Ruch passed away this morning, June 12, 2025, surrounded by his husband and dear friends, following a courageous battle with acute myeloid leukemia.”

Acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) is a cancer of the blood and bone marrow that affects myeloid cells, according to the Mayo Clinic, which also says AML is the most common type of acute leukemia in adults.
Dungey said that Ruch, who served as head of content for HGTV, was a force who helped those around him.

“Throughout his three-decade career, Loren was the rare leader who lifted everyone around him,” Dungey continued. “Known for his unwavering dedication, endless kindness, and unshakeable integrity, Loren built not only hit shows but enduring relationships, serving as mentor, advocate and true friend to countless colleagues across the television landscape.

“His impact stretched far beyond the screen. Loren was the connective tissue of every room he entered — the glue that bound teams, departments, and friendships. He possessed the rare gift of making people feel seen, valued, and inspired to do their best work.”

Dungey singled out Ruch for helping to mold such shows as “My Lottery Dream Home,” “Barbie Dreamhouse Challenge,” “Celebrity IOU,” “Battle on the Beach” and the Emmy-nominated “A Very Brady Renovation.”
“For those of us lucky enough to have known and loved Loren, the things we remember, and cherish go far beyond his professional accomplishments,” Dungey wrote.

“We warmly recall the way he supported his team and his colleagues, celebrating their victories and lending a sympathetic ear when things were difficult. Loren’s light touched everyone lucky enough to know him," she added. "Though gone too soon, he leaves behind a lasting imprint on both the television industry and the lives of those who loved him.”
Stars from HGTV also mourned Ruch’s death on social media.
Christina Haack, known for the HGTV series "Flip or Flop" and "Christina on the Coast," paid tribute to Ruch on her Instagram.
“Loren — you were one of the rare ones and the real ones,” she wrote on her Instagram stories. “Everyone adored you. You are loved by so many and will be missed dearly.”
“Revealed” host Veronica Valencia penned a heartfelt message about how Ruch supported her and others.

“Loren — thank you for believing in me, for seeing me, and for championing not just me but so many others,” Valencia wrote on her Instagram stories. You were not just a network exec — you were a mentor, confidant and a protector of creative dreams. Now, you’re an angel. Simply, thank you. We love you. RIP.”
"Property Brothers" star Jonathan Scott posted pictures of Ruch on his Instagram stories alongside a message honoring his memory.
"Struggling with the loss of my friend tonight. Loren, you're one of the great ones," he wrote.
Ruch is survived by his husband, David Salas, his parents and his brother.

title: Donna Kelce, Lisa Rinna to Compete on ‘The Traitors’ Season 4. See Full Cast List
summary: The official cast of "The Traitors" Season 4 has been announced. See everyone who will be vying for the cash prize in the new season
story: Travis Kelce's mom, Donna Kelce, "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" star Lisa Rinna and more are headed to Scotland.
Peacock unveiled the official cast list for "The Traitors" Season 4 on June 20, and it features an all new lineup of amazing stars.

"The Traitors" features reality stars and celebrities playing a hidden role, murder mystery game. After being divided into two groups — Faithfuls and Traitors — the Faithfuls have to correctly identify and vote out all the Traitors in order to walk away with a grand prize. If any Traitors remain, they take all the money.
Series host Alan Cumming previously said the Emmy-winning show, entering its fourth season, is "obsessive."

“I think the players gets obsessed and so do the audience gets obsessed because you get to watch people lying, so it’s like a sociological experiment,” he said on TODAY with Jenna & Friends in January.
“I think that’s the thing that you get to watch people having to do things against their will that we all do every day in a little way,” he said.

title: Bryan Cranston Reveals Why He Doesn't Give His Daughter Advice
summary: Bryan Cranston opens up about how he curates his roles, his work ethic and the advice he doesn't give his daughter, "The Pitt" star Taylor Dearden.
story: If you stand still too long, people will peg you — at least according to Bryan Cranston. “I like to keep people guessing,” he tells TODAY.com in a sit-down interview.
That’s why the “Breaking Bad” actor says he prefers to “keep moving around” instead.
“If I’m playing a lot of dramatic roles recently, I will look for comedic roles and I keep swimming back and forth so that I’m not pegged as any given one person,” he says.
It’s that versatility that’s earned Cranston six Emmy Awards, two Tonys, a best actor Oscar nomination and a host of other accolades. And, at 69, he shows no signs of slowing down anytime soon.

Cranston currently appears in the latest Wes Anderson film, “The Phoenician Scheme,” along with starring in “Everything’s Going to Be Great,” a new drama for which Cranston learned how to play the bagpipes. If that’s not enough, he’ll soon be crossing the Atlantic to perform on London’s famed West End in the Arthur Miller play “All My Sons,” starting in November.

“I do love it. I have a relationship with this,” explains Cranston. “It takes a committed relationship, that you’re committing to this as your life, just like you would in your personal life. And if you do so, you have a chance to be successful in your personal life or your business life.”

No stranger to success, Cranston got his start doing bit parts in a variety of TV shows and movies before landing the breakout role of Hal Wilkerson in “Malcolm in the Middle” in 2000. It's a role that earned him a handful of Emmy nominations and made Cranston a household name.

However, it was the brief part he played in a 1998 episode of “The X-Files” that put Cranston on the radar of one of the show’s writers, Vince Gilligan. Eight years later, when Gilligan went to cast Walter White in his new antihero show, “Breaking Bad,” he remembered Cranston and rang up the actor’s agent. That decision would forever cement their legacies in television history.
'You’re Only as Good as You Dare to Be Bad'

With a storied career in film, stage and television (both behind and in front of the camera), Cranston says he continues to seek out unique roles and opportunities that speak to him on a personal level.

“My real life is filled with a variety of different characters. I’m sometimes sincere, sometimes silly, sometimes moody, sometimes romantic ... and so there are different facets of ourselves that you are familiar with in your own life. Sometimes you’re sad, sometimes you’re joyous,” explains Cranston.

“So, I curate the roles I do. I look for roles that I can be different or something that challenges me that, 'Ooh, that’s really not like me at all,' so I need to dive into that and see what comes of it,” he says.

In fact, it’s his willingness to take risks that’s gotten him this far, and it’s based on advice he once received. Though Cranston can’t quite remember exactly where he got it from, he says that outside of being kind, working hard and showing up on time, it's the best advice he's ever gotten.

“You’re only as good as you dare to be bad, right? If you take chances that you could fall on your face, you could fail, it’s that point that you can also turn and have it really work. So, don’t play safe. Extend yourself, take chances, take risks and see what happens,” Cranston tells TODAY.com.
Is that the advice he gives his daughter, actor Taylor Dearden?

“First of all, as her dad, she does not want my direct advice,” he says with a laugh about Dearden, whom he shares with wife Robin Dearden. The 32-year-old currently stars in the Max hospital drama “The Pitt,” a role for which she’s garnered glowing reviews.
“Taylor is a wonderful, hardworking actor,” Cranston told Craig Melvin during a recent segment on TODAY. “She grew up in this business with my wife and I being actors. And so, we’re so proud of her.”
‘I Need to Outwork Everyone’
While Cranston may not dole out much career advice to Dearden, he tells TODAY.com that he does what he can to be a solid role model instead.

“The only thing that I can relay to her is how I have been for her 32 years on this planet and try to live a good life and be an exemplar to her, as she can look at and say, ‘Well, this is how he did things and that seemed to work for him.’ Or, ‘Oh, he tried that and that didn’t work, so I’m going to do something different,’” he explains.
“That’s basically it. Just live a true life and let your kids see that and hopefully they’ll make their own proper decisions.”
That mindset likely comes from his parents, who Cranston says were instrumental in instilling his own work ethic.

“Both my mother and father were hardworking people and they came from very humble, hardworking families, (they were) children during the Depression. It was, go out there every single day, try to find a job. That’s what their parents were faced with. And so it carries on,” says Cranston.
With his parents as his example, Cranston says he learned early on that if he wanted to make a career out of acting, he needed to be fully committed.

“I realized as a young actor that there were always going to be actors who were better than me. At the same time, there were always going to be actors who weren’t as good as me. And the only thing I can control is how hard I worked,” he explains.

“I know I can outwork people and that was my motto — I need to outwork everyone. So when I was a young actor, 22, 23, people were going out and they were partying every night. Not me. I was like, ‘I’m going to class. I’m studying. I’m learning monologues because I need to outwork everybody and I need to be ready.’ And that was it, because this is what I wanted. I wanted a career as an actor.”
And it’s that advice that Cranston passes along to young actors hoping to follow in his footsteps.

“I say, ‘You’ve got to commit.’ It’s got to be, ‘You’re all in, go all in.’ Because if you’re not putting all of your energy into it, what are you waiting for? Why would you not? You've got to. And it still doesn’t mean you’re going to be successful, just like a personal life. But you’ve got to try, and that’s what it comes down to.”
